etymology.description: 人民 (the people) + 币 (currency) = people’s currency (national currency of the people).
etymology.interpretation: Official currency of the People’s Republic of China, literally “people’s currency.” Commonly abbreviated as RMB or CNY.
etymology.simplification: 幣 was simplified to 币 during PRC character simplification, adopting an ancient/abbreviated form with fewer strokes for ease of writing; the term became standard with the modern currency after 1949.

examples.chinese: 我用人民币付款(我用人民幣付款)。
人民币对美元的汇率今天上涨了(人民幣對美元的匯率今天上漲了)。
examples.pinyin: Rénmínbì duì Měiyuán de huìlǜ jīntiān shàngzhǎng le.
examples.english: The RMB exchange rate against the U.S. dollar rose today.

examples.chinese: 在中国(在中國)，人民币是法定货币(人民幣是法定貨幣)。
examples.pinyin: Zài Zhōngguó, Rénmínbì shì fǎdìng huòbì.
examples.english: In China, the renminbi is legal tender.
